benchmark_details.name: SOFA (Social Fairness)
benchmark_details.overview: SOFA is a large-scale benchmark designed to address the limitations of existing fairness collections, expanding the analysis of social biases in language models to include a diverse range of identities and stereotypes.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate social biases encoded in language models by probing their responses across a diverse set of identities and stereotypes.

data.source: Combining stereotypes from the SOCIAL BIAS INFERENCE CORPUS (SBIC) and identities from the lexicon by Czarnowska et al. (2021).

methodology.calculation: Perplexity is calculated using the exponentiated average negative log-likelihood of a sequence.
methodology.interpretation: Low PPL values indicate higher likelihood for certain stereotypes, suggesting presence of bias.
methodology.validation: Evaluated by testing against existing benchmarks.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Analysis conducted across various identity dimensions such as gender, religion, disability, and nationality.
targeted_risks.harm: The benchmark aims to identify and measure the encoded biases which lead to unfair treatments in language model outputs.
